body_content.explanation: the property of a chemical reaction in which the position of the atoms within the molecules (= a unit of a chemical substance made of a group of two or more atoms) involved in the reaction controls the result:
examples: Stereospecificity is central to biochemistry, and even small changes in the shapes of molecules can have profound effects.
There appears to be limited stereospecificity for anti-malarial activity among the acids that we tested.
